thread.title: Easybook Now Offers Seven Seas Holiday Ferry Tickets to all Kuala Besut Customers
thread.title_full: Easybook Now Offers Seven Seas Holiday Ferry Tickets to all Kuala Besut Customers

author: prbuzz.com
title: Easybook Now Offers Seven Seas Holiday Ferry Tickets to all Kuala Besut Customers
text:
Easybook, an online booking platform for ferry, bus, local tours and train tickets, recently launched Seven Seas Holiday ferry tickets at their site. The tickets were launched by the company on September 17, 2015 at their booking site. Customers living in Kuala Besut can readily avail the ferry tickets anytime to visit and enjoy a comfortable ride to the Perhentian Island.
The Perhentian Island is known for its white sandy beaches paired as well as clear water. The beaches are flanked by jungle-covered hills giving visitors spectacular views to enjoy aside from the waters itself. These two reasons are among the common ones that make people interested to visit the island again and again. Fortunately, finding transportation to the island can now be done with ease due to many ferry operators offering their services to locals and visitors. Riding a ferry boat is one of ways to get to the island. Those interested to can easily book for ferry tickets at Easybook.com where Seven Seas Holiday ferry tickets are now also available.
It takes about 45 minutes of travel by riding a ferry boat to reach the island. Customers who avail the Seven Seas Holiday tickets will have Kuala Besut Jetty – Terengganu as their departure point. Daily ferry departures are available to and fro the Kuala Besut and the Perhentian Island for those who are planning to go to the island.
Kuala Besut residents who are planning to go and enjoy the offerings of the Perhentian Island can now avail Easybook’s recently launched Holiday ferry tickets from Seven Seas. With the coming holidays now getting nearer, Easybook aims to help customers reach their destination in the easiest and most comfortable way. Those who are planning to spend their holidays in the island simply need to go to Easybook to book for their ferry tickets.
The main headquarter of Easybook is located in Singapore. It was founded in 2005, offering a convenient place where customers can book bust tickets going to Malaysia. But today, the company is also offering ferry tickets as well by partnering with ferry operators serving customers from Indonesia, Brunei, Malaysia and Singapore. The Seven Seas Holiday ferry tickets are just one of the newly launched ferry tickets which the company now offers for booking at their official site.
Feel free to go to http://www.easybook.com/Pages_SGMY/news/seven-seas-holiday.aspx to learn more about Easybook’s Seven Seas Holiday ferry tickets.
